Posts.Content: Jun 26, 2009 07:37PM cwilliamson wrote: I have been reading all of the posts for a week or so but have never written.  My first treatment was June 12.  It looks now that I will have 4 AC and then surgery.  After that, 4 more treatments of a different family of drugs.  I am at day 14 and a bit more hair is falling.  Guess we are all going thru this at the same time.  We moved from Missouri to Arkansas in January leaving family and friends behind and then the diagnosis came in May.  Most days are good but others not so much.  Very homesick for family and friends.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 28, 2009 03:48PM cwilliamson wrote: I was told by a friend in Missouri that has just finished her chemo that you cannot dye your hair until one year after your last chemo treatment so I checked with my Oncologist and he confirmed it.  My thought is that if I can't color for over a year, everyone is going to know I have grey hair so what the heck!  Was wondering before the dx how I could get to a point of not coloring without looking dumb but I guess that problem got taken care of for me.  My oldest daughter told me there is better ways to get perkier boobs and not color your hair besides cancer.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jul 21, 2009 01:13PM cwilliamson wrote: Mary. . . I have a friend in MO that had the same problem you are having with infection and the skin dying.  She was in the hospital 3 times after her mastectomy.  They could not start reconstruction on her at that time.  She has now all healed, finished chemo, hair growing back and will have her reconstruction in September.  She says she feels wonderful!!.  She has had a very rough time just as you are going thru now but she made it and I know you will do the same.  Will keep you in my prayers.  3rd A/C on Thursday.  Ready to be finished as I am sure you all feel the same.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Aug 3, 2009 08:24AM cwilliamson wrote: Polly - know what you mean.  #3 was the worst yet.  Really not looking forward to #4 but at least it is the last A/C.  What are you taking after A/C?  They told me Taxol 12X weekly or Taxotere 4X every 3 wks.  Must have surgery first.  Figure the end will be just before Christmas. Has anyone out there had their #4 A/C?  If so, how did it go? Susie - Wow, you must be very happy!!  Congrats!  What are you going to do about your poison hair?  I have fuzz also, should I leave it or shave again? Everyone, hang in there!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 27, 2009 11:41AM cwilliamson wrote: You gals are great!  As I sit here running my fingers thru my hair with bunches coming out.  I want to cry but you make me laugh.  It is extremely hot here so no balcony for me.  Just sit in front of the trash can.  Did any of you have a headache as your hair started to fall?  I did not get a shot after my first tx, is that the normal thing?
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2009 08:42PM cwilliamson wrote: Well ladies, got the hair taken down to 1/2" tonight and had the wig styled.  Think it was a relief.  I know that this will also come out but I feel like I am just not waiting around.  Not so messy either!  Don't feel so much like "Bozo" with the wig on.  See the surgeon tomorrow.  They are having to shrink my cancer before surgery.  Maybe we will have more answers.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jul 13, 2009 09:48AM cwilliamson wrote: Pam, how cool is it that you have family in Russellville.  Nice area and we have made a few friends from church but my husband and I are both very homesick for our families in Missouri and Illinois.  Sometimes it is just hard to understand what God is doing these days.  Went to LGFB class this morning and it was really fun.  Didn't have any wigs that appealed to me but I don't really wear the one that I have.  Day 11 after #2 A/C treatment and I still have eyelashes and eyebrows.  Shaved head but still a bit left.  Is that unusual?  Thought every single hair on my body was going to go away.  So far, haven't had that experience. PJKAPPEL. . Several ladies at the LGFB class this morning were talking about their eyes watering all the time so apparently that is a pretty common side affect.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Sep 2, 2009 02:48PM cwilliamson wrote: Woohoo!!  Saw the Onc. today and I do not have to have another treatment before surgery on the 16th.  No bloodwork either.  I feel like a free woman for 2 weeks.  Still bald but a free woman.  I will start my 12 Taxol on Oct. 7.  Don't know about the Rads til after surgery.  Polly. . Glad you don't have SE yet and hope they don't start.  I am watching closely because I will be following in your footsteps the 7th.   Thinking of everyone!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jul 27, 2009 04:57AM cwilliamson wrote: Good Morning to all my June Friends! Had my #3tx of A/C on Thursday and had quite a rough weekend.  A LOT of nausea, dry heaves and fatique.  Just 1 more A/C to go before surgery, then more chemo of another drug.  Yuck!!  Figure I won't be finished until December.   I had not gained any weight when I went for my #2 tx and had lost 2 lbs. when I went for my #3.  I definitely can't afford to gain any weight at this point but am not trying to lose.  Appetite really never bounces back after treatment.  If numbers stay good, I will be able to attend my granddaughter's 4th birthday party in St. Louis.  Most of my kids will be their with their children so I really want to go.  Haven't seen new grandson since he was born in May.  Living far away from family really sucks! My Onc. and beautician say no manicure or pedicure until treatments are done.  They never said how long after - just after.   Would really like to have a pedicure! Daughter is moving from Iowa to South Carolina and will be getting here this morning to stay for a few days before heading on to SC.  Haven't seen them since Christmas.  Just hope the SE from treatment don't ruin the visit.   Hope you all had a good weekend!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Sep 18, 2009 09:57AM cwilliamson wrote: Hi Girls and Tom...I had my bilateral mastectomy on Wednesday and just got home about an hour ago.  It was much easier than I thought it would be.  Surgeon removed 3 lymph glands.  Chemo before surgery did a great job on the cancer.  I feel very relieved to have the cancer out.  Not looking forward to the rest of the chemo though. Hang in there!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2009 08:17PM cwilliamson wrote: Jane. . . I have one more AC to go, then surgery, then 12 weeks of Taxol.  Am very concerned about SE with the treatments being weekly.  Are the SE less since it is a smaller dose?
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jul 1, 2009 01:10PM cwilliamson wrote: Hi Chemo Friends, My tx 2 of A/C is tomorrow.  Not quite as scared as the 1st one.  Just wondering if the SE will be the same.  Did not have nuelasta last time so not sure what will happen with this one. Saw the surgeon yesterday.  My cancer has to shrink before they can do surgery.  I see him again on August 24 after 4 rounds of A/C.  He will do an MRI to find out how much of the cancer is left.  I have pretty much decided to go ahead with a mastectomy on the right breast but am debating about the left.  Unless cancer shows up on the MRI in the left breast, it is clean.  Must decide if I want to have a mastectomy on both sides.  Have any of you had to face that decision?  Don't know the statistics on cancer occuring in the other breast once you have had one removed. As for ports, mine was put in when they did the biopsy.  It was a pain (literally) for a while but it sure makes the treatments a snap.  Did not feel a thing so I feel a little different about it now.  I am a hard stick so this makes it much more comfortable.   Been a rough couple of days as far as meltdowns go.  Not sure why it has hit me at this particular time but this shall pass, I am sure.   Hope everyone has a wonder holiday weekend.  We can do this!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2009 12:59PM cwilliamson wrote: For those that have had a mastectomy.  Were you able to sleep in your bed when you came home from the hospital or was a recliner your new best friend.  Also, how long was your stay in the hospital?  4th A/C on the 17th.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Aug 12, 2009 10:30AM cwilliamson wrote: I unexpectedly had my #4 AC this morning.  Was supposed to see the doc so he could tell me if I could go to St. Louis for my granddaughter's 4th birthday and then have my 4th treatment on Monday.  Didn't want to feel yuck at the party.  Well. . . he changed his mind and said I couldn't wait til Monday to have the treatment so I got it this morning.  Not real happy with him at this point but I doubt he cares.  They did order a different med for nausea that is supposed to be better so we will see if it helps.  Have lost 10# since treatments started. Nausea and loss of appetite is a big SE for me. Hope you are all doing well!!!!!  Thanks for being there!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jul 13, 2009 08:35PM cwilliamson wrote: PDAW. . .I had my infusion on July 2.  Day 1, 2 & 3 were pretty good and I was getting really cocky and sure I was going to have hardly any se with tx 2.  On Sunday, it hit like a ton of bricks and I really didn't feel better until the next Thursday.  Guess I won't be getting so cocky any more.  Becoming more apparent that you can't have expectations from these treatments, just take it as it comes.  No disappointments that way.   As of now, my last 4 treatments will be taxol or taxotere.  I still have surgery to go thru so that could change.  Just 2 more A/C.  Yippee!!!! Met a lady today at LGFB class that had double mast. and had her reconstruction.  She comes to the meetings to encourage those of us in the midst of the battle.  She actually had hair and looked really normal. (boobs and all)  We will all be there someday and then we can encourage others in the midst of their journey.  Take care my friends!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2009 01:17PM cwilliamson wrote: My Onc said (not coloring for a year) it was due to the chemicals in the dye and it will cause your new hair to break off.  That would be awful if we are finally getting new hair!  Finally visiting the beautician tonight to go down to 1/2 inch.  I am at day 17 so there isn't much left.  Hopefully, she can work with my wig so I don't look like Bozo the Clown.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Sep 7, 2009 05:19PM cwilliamson wrote: Pam...My Oncologist said it takes the chances down to less than 1%.  That is why I have decided on a double mastectomy.  Pretty scared about it but I just want to move on.  If anyone has had a mastectomy, let me know what it was like.  Please!!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Sep 13, 2009 11:05AM cwilliamson wrote: Hi Girls, I am having my bilater mastectomy on Wednesday.  Finished my 4 AC and will have 12 weekly Taxol after surgery beginning Oct. 7.  Don't know about rads yet.  I really want the surgery done but am a bit scared at the same time.  Afraid I will have a meltdown when I get to the hospital on Wednesday.  I am pretty good at meltdowns lately.   All of you hang in there.  Polly...have a great time with your son!  So does the fuzz not count as hair?
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2009 10:20AM cwilliamson wrote: Happy Saturday My June Friends, Had my 2nd AC on July 2.  Has been a rough week but hoping to be bouncing back.  Still have a bit of hair but just wish it would go.  Kind of look scragly!  Not much liking the wig!  Did go online at franceluxe.com and received the wrap.  Very nice and received a very kind card from all the employees.  There are still caring folks around!   PAP. . . what other supplements are you using?  I am going to try the Astralagus for the blood count.  I have had 2 tx and have not had to have Neulasta yet.  I will be 62 next Tuesday.  Sure would like to make it thru without it.   Are any of you hesitant about going out in public?  Just like to stay home so I don't have to put anything on my head.  Don't like the wig and everything is just plain hot.  Think maybe I am just being difficult! Take care and have a great weekend!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Sep 15, 2009 10:37AM cwilliamson wrote: Cherneski...I had to have 4 AC before surgery and then a breast MRI.  12 weekly Taxol after surgery. Surgery (double mastectomy) is scheduled for 2 pm tomorrow at Baptist Health Center in Little Rock, AR.  I am really ready but still having some weepy moments.  I am sure everything will go fine, just the anticipation.  I believe you when you say surgery is the easiest part because AC sure was not easy.  Still feel sick most of the time and my last treatment was Aug. 12. The se from Taxol don't sound so great.  Both surgeon and onc. said it would be easier on me but not so sure.   Hang in there everyone.  We can get thru this!!!!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2009 01:11PM cwilliamson wrote: Blessedby4. . I had my hair cut down to 1/2 " on the 17th day after my 1st tx.  Felt it was too long and scragly looking.  On Saturday (day 10 after tx 2) I used my husbands beard trimmer to take it down to like a short buzz cut.  I like it that way.  Still have some very sparce hair but I am sure it will go over time.  I do still have eyebrows and eyelashes and I REALLY hope they stay.  Would be interested to know if everyone else is totally bald yet and if you have eyebrows and eyelashes.  Everyone of you are such a blessing!  You are making this journey a better place to be.  Thanks!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2009 08:14PM cwilliamson wrote: pdaw. . .Yes, my tx #3 is on July 23.  A is a rough drug.  Guess that is why they call it "the red devil".  Two more to go of A/C.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Sep 22, 2009 08:47AM cwilliamson wrote: Deborah...so sorry you are having such a rough time.  I love your wig!  Guess they will be easier to wear since fall is almost here.  I don't feel so much like people are staring at me when I have it on.  Polly...glad you had a good time with your son.  Military definitely makes them grow up.  I have 2 sons in the military and saw a big difference in them after basic.  I am with you, Polly, ready for fall and cooler weather.  DH closed the pool on Sunday so that is a sure sign that warm weather is going away.  Still very warm in Arkansas but this will end soon, I hope. A week ago tomorrow since I had BM.  Things are going OK.  Just hate these darned drains.  Not much pain just uncomfortable from the drains.  DID I MENTION I HATE THESE DRAINS.  Start Taxol on Oct. 7.  Actually, ready to get started so it can be done.  DO NOT have to do radiation.  AC pretty much eradicated the cancer from what the surgeon says. For those that have surgery to come, it was much easier than I anticipated.  Good luck! My DD flies in this afternoon from North Carolina to stay for 2 weeks.  She was to get here yesterday but flights were canceled due to weather in Atlanta.  Hope she makes it today.  She is an awesome cook!!!  Taught her everything she knows except that I have forgotten how to use those skills.  Actually, don't know if I forgot or just don't care to use them!! Everyone take care!  I so enjoy reading your posts!!  You are a great bunch of folks!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jul 23, 2009 09:57PM cwilliamson wrote: Had my A/C treatment #3 of 4 today and Onc. told me I would have either Taxotere or Taxol after the surgery.  Taxotere would be every 3 weeks X 4 and Taxol would be evert week X 12.  Got online and looked up some research since he is leaving it up to me.  Every week sounds tough but the dose would be less and SE would, hopefully, be less.  Am very confused.  Are any of you doing the weekly thing with Taxol or taking the 3 week treatments with Taxotere.  How are you finding the SE? My blood was good again so no Nuelasta.  He said I must have some great bone marrow!   My prayers are with all of you struggling with this "monster"  We can get thru this! Still have fuzz, eyebrows and eyelashes.  What is with that?  Not complaining mind you but I thought all this stuff was going to go away.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2009 01:56PM cwilliamson wrote: gjlanders...you have come too far to give up now.  I know it is really hard when work situations make you miserable but you are the most important thing.  My son was stationed at Ft. Huachuca several times.  Just retired last November. I had my #1 of 12 Taxol today.  Saw the Oncologist for the first time since bi mx on 9/16.  The AC totally melted away the Cancer.  It was just gone.  Good news!!  Don't think I will need rads. Everyone keep up the good fight!!!!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Aug 20, 2009 10:20AM cwilliamson wrote: Hi Everyone, Just been reading everyone's posts and thinking.  Welcome to those of you that are new to the site.  I have enjoyed everyone so much and learned a lot, too! Some of you are really having awful SE.  I am so sorry.  I had my last AC last Wednesday and then went to see kids and grandkids in MO.  Think that was the best medicine I could have.  I miss them all so much.  Still questioning why we were brought to Arkansas just to get sick.  Oh well, maybe someday it will become apparent.   I feel like I am in a holding pattern right now.  I see my surgeon on Monday and have an MRI so I will probably have one mastectomy and possibly both.  They had to shrink my cancer before they could remove it.  After, there are 12 Taxol treatments so I probably won't finish until just before Christmas.  Many of you will be past this by then.  I really envy you, just want to get going and get this over.  I am anxious to see how all of you 12 Taxol girls do! Candy. . . when did they do the DIEP procedure on you? Seems there are decisions to make now.  Kind of overwhelming! Hang in there, girls and Tom!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Aug 21, 2009 04:29PM cwilliamson wrote: Polly. . .did you have the DIEP at the same time as the mastectomy or later?  I just want this cancer out.  Have been having a lot of pain in that breast.  Onc. says tumors and fingers are shrinking into a ball.  He said that is good.  Guess I feel I can't really move forward until the surgery is done.  Have been kind of whinie the past week, sorry.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2010 10:19AM cwilliamson wrote: Where is everyone?  Not many posts lately.  Hope it is because everyone is doing so well, they are not even thinking about Cancer anymore. My last weekly Taxol was Dec. 22.  When can I expect side effects to ease and hair to start growing?  Guess my expectations were higher than reality.  Still debating on reconstruction.  Are the te and implants painful?  Already getting tired of the fake boobs! Happy New Year to everyone!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Aug 28, 2009 06:37AM cwilliamson wrote: It has been a rough week so I have put off posting cause I am a crab.  Saw the surgeon on Monday and had a breast MRI.  He called me Tuesday evening to tell me there was something suspicious on the other side and we would need to do a biopsy, etc.  Do not want to live that way so I told him I wanted both breasts removed.  Surgery is scheduled for Sept. 16. Concerned the Onc. will make me do another treatment since my last one was Sept. 12 and surgery isn't til the 16th.  Afraid it will be another AC.  That would about do it for me.  Has anyone ever heard of them doing 5 tx of AC?  The surgeon told me he wouldn't know about rads until after he got in there.  Still scheduled for 12 taxol after surgery.  He said there may be even more, depending on what he finds.   This is never going to be over.  Thought by Christmas I would be thru this but it doesn't look that way.  I feel as many of you have expressed - sick of it all and just want to be "normal" again.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Aug 3, 2009 03:02PM cwilliamson wrote: Polly - Actually, he has given me the choice.  I wonder if the SE are less with the weekly treatments.  According to the studies I have seen, Taxol weekly gives you better odds.  I am just afraid of the SE weekly.  A/C has been ugly, sure wouldn't want that every week.  If so, might as well crawl in bed and not come out til 12 weeks are up. I am 62 and have diabetes, heart disease and other really fun stuff but I keep on keeping up.  Don't let things slow me down too much.  My blood has been really good.  Maybe that is why he gave me the choice.  I see the surgeon on the 24th so maybe I will talk to him.  He specializes in surgical oncology of the breast.  Wish this surgery was behind me.  Sound kind of grumpy today, don't I.  Missing my family in Missouri.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Sep 1, 2009 08:13PM cwilliamson wrote: Diane48. . I have had pain with my port ever since they put it in.  Have had 2 shoulder surgeries on that side so don't know if that makes a difference.  Even though I hate the thing, glad I have it when I see the nurses trying to find an IV site on other patients. Those that had DBL MX, did you think recovery was really hard? Welcome to our new girls, you will love this board!!!!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Sep 3, 2009 09:25PM cwilliamson wrote: Anna...my port was put in at the time of my biopsy.  I have commented before that mine has been pretty uncomfortable.  Actually, gave me more problems than the biopsy site.  I really believe my problems stem from the two shoulder surgeries that I have had.  I have a screw in my shoulder really close to the port.  The shoulder hurt before the port so it makes sense that things would not suddenly be all better. Polly...glad you are doing well so far.  I know you don't want to get too confident just in case.  With this chemo stuff, you don't know what tomorrow is going to bring.  Hopefully, a big fat "nothin". Tom...my heart goes out to you both for your wife and your son.  We have 6 children and 12 grandchildren so I know how tough it is.  Can't tell you how many times my heart has been broken.  Will keep your family in my prayers.  Sometimes that is all we can do for our kids until they are ready to grow up.  Sometimes I think I want to give up being a Mom and try something that is more fun and doesn't hurt so much. Hang in there everyone and have a wonderful holiday weekend.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Aug 12, 2009 03:28PM cwilliamson wrote: Wonderful video, so glad you posted it.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Aug 23, 2009 02:30PM cwilliamson wrote: Joanie. . . when I had my first AC tx, we asked if there was anything I should not eat and the onc. nurses said soy products.  They did not say why, just that I could not have them.  Tx 4 is done.  See the surgeon tomorrow and have MRI.  Hopefully, surgery will be soon so the Taxol can start and this can be done.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Dec 18, 2009 02:50PM cwilliamson wrote: TomnDi. . . Haven't been on myself in a very long time.  Think a lot of ladies are finished or close to it and aren't on as much.  I was just thinking about you 2 the other day and wondering how it is going. (actually, forgot my password - chemo brain) I have one more weekly Taxol next Tuesday.  No radiation for me.  Chemo brain is still there but it sounds as if your lives have way too much going on.  No wonder her head is spinning.  Cancer is tough enough to deal with but, it is much worse when there are so many issues.  We are having family issues (grown children) as well and it definitely takes a toll.  Maybe Di needs to try to concentrate on her progress.  How many of the other issues can she change?  In talking with friends, some say it takes 5-6 months to get thru some of these side effects. Yuck!!! Actually, don't think there a normal, as we knew it, after cancer.  We just have to find a "new" normal and that is not so easy.  We must think of ourselves and what we have been thru.  Most of us have not been in a habit of doing that but I certainly don't consider that being selfish - just smart!  There are just so many things in life we cannot change.  Finding happiness thru it all is difficult but you both deserve that.  Hang in there guys!!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee

Posts.Content: Jan 21, 2010 06:01PM cwilliamson wrote: Seems we are all at the end or getting close.  Guess I won't feel like the end until all the se are gone and I look like a healthy person again. Last Taxol treatment was Dec. 22 and I do not have to get radiation.  Hair is still not doing anything, brows only thinned and eyelashes are long since I use a glaucoma med that causes eyelashes to grow.  Sinus is doing better.  The biggie is the pain in legs, ankles feet, arms and hands.  Just ready to be me again.  Started taking Arimidex. (spelling?) Says it can make your hair thin. Don't think it could get any thinner right now!! Have any of you had a problem with that med? Having PET scan next week and Onc did tumor markers last week.  No results yet. Colonoscopy in 2 months. Trying to make a decision about reconstruction.  Didn't think I wanted it but gets old strapping on the boobs and putting on the wig before going out.  Haven't been going out much but think that isn't good for the mind. Trying really hard to not let cancer define my life. Since about the 5th Taxol treatment - I feel I am not doing such a hot job at that.   Is anyone else struggling with not bouncing back the way you thought?  Maybe it is just the winter blahs! Hang in there, we are almost finished!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo June 2009 zuzeee zuzeee
